section_title: Variables and Data Types in Python
section_description: This section introduces variables, basic data types, and type conversion in Python through interactive coding exercises and practical examples.
learning_objectives: Identify and use common Python data types.
Convert between data types using built-in functions.
Apply type hints to variables and functions.
Debug common type-related errors in code.

lessons.lesson_objective: Students will be able to declare variables and assign values using appropriate syntax and operators.

exercises.exercise_instructions: Write Python code to declare variables for your name, age, and favorite color, then print each value.
Create two variables with numeric values and swap their contents using assignment operators.
Rename poorly named variables (e.g., 'a=5') to follow Python's PEP8 naming conventions.

lessons.lesson_objective: Students will be able to identify and manipulate Pythonâ€™s fundamental data types including integers, floats, strings, and booleans.

exercises.exercise_instructions: Create variables of each core data type and use the type() function to verify their types.
Combine two strings and a number into a single sentence using string formatting techniques.
Write expressions using comparison operators that evaluate to True and False with different data types.

lessons.lesson_objective: Students will be able to perform explicit and implicit type conversion between numeric, string, and boolean types.

exercises.exercise_instructions: Take input from the user as a string and convert it to an integer for arithmetic operations.
Write code that adds a string and a number after proper type conversion.
Use try-except blocks to handle invalid type conversions and display meaningful error messages.

lessons.lesson_objective: Students will be able to apply type hints to variables and function parameters to improve code clarity and validation.
key_topics: Function parameter and return type annotations
Using mypy for static type checking

exercises.exercise_instructions: Add type hints to variables storing numbers, strings, and boolean values.
Write a function that adds two numbers and include type annotations for parameters and return value.
Use the mypy tool to check a Python script for type consistency and fix any errors reported.

lessons.lesson_objective: Students will be able to debug and resolve common type-related errors in Python programs.
key_topics: Using print() and type() for diagnostics

exercises.exercise_instructions: Debug and correct a provided Python script containing intentional type-related errors.
Modify a script to log variable types at runtime to identify mismatches before execution.
Write code that ensures user input is of the expected type before performing calculations.
